org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

div1.p: DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND LABOR Bureau of IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION Washington.

The Bureau acknowledges the recepit of your letter of March 6, 1912, No. 42505, transmitting record of hearing accorded the alien Sam Plastino, who landed presumably at the port of New York, N.Y., on or about January 1st, 1897.

After a careful examination of the evidence submitted in this case, the Department is of opinion that the alien is in the United States in vio- lation of law. You are therefore directed to cause him to be taken into cus- tody and conveyed to New York, N. Y., for deportation, the expenses incident to such conveyance, including the employment of an attendant to assist in delivery, if necessary, at a nominal compensation of $1.00 and expenses both ways, being authorized, payable from the appropriation "Expenses of Regulating Immigration, 1912."
Execution of the warrant of deportation should be held in abey- ance until such time as the alien is released from prison by the proper au- thorities.
Respectfully, (Sg.) Dan'l J. Keefe, Commissioner General.
I hereby certify that the foregoing is an exact copy of original let- ter on file in this office. John H. Sargent. Commr of Immigration.
